title: Ticket #7529: User-provided token attributes
description:
Now that we have a 'blacklist' capability that treats tokens as ClassAds, we should leverage the fact that tokens are internally key-value pairs and additional attributes can be useful for managing the tokens.

For example, suppose I want the glideinWMS frontend to be able to generate a startd token that enables a pilot to advertise to a collector. For audit purposes, I might like to add various domain-specific information to the token itself such as the CE or the site I submitted the pilot to.

Right now, we basically force folks to put this metadata into the identity as that's the only user-controlled thing -- and auditing is not an identity!
